definition: to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]
surname Shua
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)

sentences.english: And Abner said to Joab, Let the young men now arise, and play before us.
sentences.chinese: 押尼珥對約押說，讓少年人起來，在我們面前戲耍吧。

sentences.english: Obviously, you want to tease an article of yours that is relevant to your website content.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，你想你就是戲耍一篇有關你的網站內容。

sentences.english: Death is abroad and children play.
sentences.chinese: 死神處處皆在，而孩子們在戲耍。

sentences.english: See the kitten on the wall, sporting with the leaves that fall.
sentences.chinese: 看牆上那隻小貓，在玩弄戲耍那些落葉飄飄。

sentences.english: Varnished, aristocratic and sumptuous colours with more acid and trifle tones.
sentences.chinese: 塗漆，貴族和華麗的色彩帶有酸性和戲耍的色調。

sentences.english: Now the temple was crowded with men and women; all the rulers of the Philistines were there, and on the roof were about three thousand men and women watching Samson perform.
sentences.chinese: 房的平頂上約有三千男女，觀看參孫戲耍。

sentences.english: If you're too busy to have fun with your children, you're too busy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你忙得連與孩子戲耍的時間都沒有。

sentences.english: Liu from Zhou Ying sun protection, play the killer snake.
sentences.chinese: 劉地擺脫周影保護孫倩，戲耍了殺手毒蛇。

sentences.english: When he arrived he saw the children playing in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 進了家門，他一眼就看見在花園中戲耍的孩子們。

sentences.english: The children are disporting themselves in the swimming pool.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在游泳池中戲耍。

sentences.english: So they called for Samson from the prison house , and he performed before them.
sentences.chinese: 於是將參孫從監裏叫出來，他就在衆人面前戲耍。

definition: to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to keep silent
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
sullen/to scowl miserably
to smash
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to tease/to poke fun at
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
red in the face/extremely angry
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
